p: The essential oil of M. longifolia showed antifungal activity against C. albicans at a concentration of 7120 mg/mL [ 126]. Mentha x piperita (Mentha of Pancalieri) EO exerted the most remarkable antifungal activity against Cryptococcus neoformans and showed non-negligible activity against Candida krusei and C. glabrata displaying the lowest minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) and minimum fungicidal concentration (MFC) values ranging from 0.06â€“0.125%, v/ v [ 127].
